page.title: 07Dewstow House
page.content: "Dewstow" means "St David on the Hill". It is supposed to be the site of one of the earliest churches dedicated to St David but there are no records to support this. There is, however, a mass grave with bones dating back to between the 10th and 13th centuries. In 1880 Dewstow House was bought by a wealthy London Barrister, Mr Henry Oakley, who built the oriental gardens and underground grotto. Before the First World War 15 gardeners were employed and the gardens were open to the public about 4 times a year. After Oakley's death in 1940 the gardens became neglected. The House is now lived in by the family of a local businessman.
